intro: Astridia citrina, commonly known as the yellow astridia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, slender leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Astridia citrina is often found in association with other native flora, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in New Zealand.
